name: complement C5a receptor 1

kegg.name: Complement and coagulation cascades - Homo sapiens (human)
Neutrophil extracellular trap formation - Homo sapiens (human)

summary: Enables G protein-coupled receptor activity and complement component C5a receptor activity. Involved in several processes, including complement component C5a signaling pathway; mRNA transcription by RNA polymerase II; and positive regulation of ERK1 and ERK2 cascade. Located in apical part of cell and basolateral plasma membrane. Biomarker of Alzheimer's disease; asthma; chronic obstructive pulmonary disease; rhinitis; and severe acute respiratory syndrome. [provided by Alliance of Genome Resources, Apr 2022]
